title: “‘How long do we want to support this thing?’ And Jensen said, ‘For as long as we shall live.’”
desc:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, that is, re: the Nvidia Shield TV, likely the most supported Android gadget ever at over a decade. Nvidia’s Andrew Bell tells Ars Technica a new model isn’t in active development, but hints at what he’d add (like AV1 and YouTube HDR). He says Nvidia doesn’t profit off its Netflix button, BTW.
[Link: Inside Nvidia's 10-year effort to make the Shield TV the most updated Android device ever | https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2026/01/inside-nvidias-10-year-effort-to-make-the-shield-tv-the-most-updated-android-device-ever/ | Ars Technica]

title: “Land is Angola’s social security”: Catholic Church, Government Urged to Lead Agricultural Regeneration Efforts
desc: The founder of the Songhai Center in Porto-Novo, Benin, has urged the Catholic Church and the Government of Angola to prioritize the restoration of degraded farmland and the training of young people in sustainable agriculture.

title: NASA's Perseverance Rover completes its first AI
desc: During the demonstration, NASA engineers used vision-language models, or VLMs, to create waypoints on Mars for Perseverance.

title: Artificial Intelligence, Job Loss, and the Psychiatric Significance of Work
desc: AI-driven job loss threatens mental health, highlighting the need for societal responses that recognize work's vital role.

title: 'ICE out' at the Grammys: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish and others use speeches to protest Trump's immigration crackdown
desc: While music's biggest night took place in Los Angeles, many stars used the occasion to demonstrate against the administration's Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations in Minneapolis.

title: Collins Sichenje: Charlton Explain Why They Signed Harambee Stars Defender
desc: Charlton Athletic signs Harambee Stars defender Collins Sichenje on a three-and-a-half-year deal, bolstering their squad as they aim for Championship success.

title: Detroit-based bank takes over assets of failed Chicago institution
desc: The move follows the closure of Metropolitan Capital Bank & Trust.

title: Sony's flagship WF-1000XM6 earbuds appear in leaked listing
desc: Sony broke ground with the WF-1000XM4 earbuds when they launched just under six years ago. Two generations later, and Sony...

title: Several Britons dead after stomach illnesses in Cape Verde - what we know so far
desc: Four British people have died within a period of four months after being struck down with stomach bugs while holidaying in Cape Verde. | ITV National News

title: US will lower India tariffs to 18% after Modi agrees to stop buying Russian oil, says Trump
desc: The US has reduced tariffs on Indian goods from 50% to 18% following an agreement for India to stop buying Russian oil. Read more at straitstimes.com.
